comments.author: Gaz Howell

comments.text:
I admit England do play boring at times, often using outdated tactics and 
systems. We are also very inconsistent. However, you can not deny that 
there is extreme quality in our squad and if the team could gel and play 
together better we would be a force to be reckoned with. We have, despite 
his current form, one of the best keepers in the world in Hart, 2 of the 
best LB's in the world in Baines and Cole, the likes of Wilshere, Gerrard, 
Lampard and Carrick in midfield who all play at the highest level of 
football and Rooney and Sturridge (top scorer in the premier league) up 
front who any team would fear. Our whole squad is full of top premier 
league players. On paper we are a great squad, but we never seem to gel as 
a team and build chemistry. It's probably due to a lesser technical ability 
to other top international squads, but that is changing - just look at the 
younger players coming in. I guarantee in 10 years, you will see a totally 
different England squad, playing creative, attacking football.
comments.author: Raekwon Da Chef

comments.author: Lucas Roy

captions.text: A draw away in the Ukraine, that was a massive result for us, because it’s a difficult place to go.
But then you have to make sure you win your home games, so that point will only be a good point if we win these home games.
That’s the challenge to us now.
We have to trust in each other, we have to be confident.
You should be qualifying for big tournaments, but everyone wants to beat England so you’re ready for a big battle…
You’ve got them three lions on the shirt and we’ve got to fight for each other, work hard for each other
There’s certainly the best young talent since I’ve been in the squad
The experienced lads have to try and help the young lads in certain games.
On the other hand the young lads you know can just come up with a bit of magic and can make things happen
Welbeck here and Danny Welbeck’s found the net again
Rooney is the great example you know, near on 80 caps and he’s only 28,
he broke into the team when he was 18, you know he’s been playing for 10 years and he can pass his experience onto us young players
Wayne Rooney!
When I first came onto the scene, I just played with no fear
and that’s exactly the same thing when these players come in and, you know, it’s a great opportunity for a lot of these young players because when you’re good enough, the manager’s going to pick you
Everyone’s competing for so many places here and that’s going to make you into a better player yourself
Andros Townsend to debut in an England starting 11 at Wembley big night for both him and the man who has chosen him.
Townsend seizing onto the ball
It’s a fabulous shot and a fabulous way to mark your debut.
Andros Townsend has arrived on the international stage
When you’re young you’ve no worries, you just play and I think that’s when you see a lot of exciting things happen
Welbeck, Sturridge, their strengths are getting behind players and taking players on and that’s what we need them to do
Penalty
Calmly dispatched and England have a 4-1 lead to take forward to their crunch night against the Poles here on Tuesday
It’s easy for me to tell these young guys, oh it’s gonna be tough
but until you’ve been there done it, I think you’re never gonna realize how difficult and how hard these situations are
From the morning when you wake up you just want the game to come.
We know if we play to our ability we’ll win the game
As a footballer you play football to win trophies and to try and be successful
I think if you look at all the great players they all have special moments of their own.
As a centre forward you’ve always got that opportunity to create your own history which obviously is also your country’s history.
Rooney!
England take a giant step in the right direction.
England are on the guestlist for football’s greatest party
It’s great obviously playing for your country, but then what I always think about is can you imagine being successful and winning something with your country
The feeling you get from playing for them...so what feeling would it be to win a trophy
It’d be incredible and that’s what we’re aiming to do.
That will be a moment that’ll live on forever

title: England Matters - Episode 3: Wayne Rooney, Jack Wilshere, Theo Walcott and Ashley Cole
